question: Upon death of an organism, during composition, what returns to the soil as ammonium ions?

nodes.text: Potassium returns to the soil as ammonium ions upon the death of an organism during composition.
Calcium returns to the soil as ammonium ions upon the decomposition of an organism.
Hydrogen returns to the soil as ammonium ions upon the death of an organism during decomposition.
Nitrogen returns to the soil as ammonium ions upon the decomposition of an organism.
